explanation: The stage direction describes the setting of the scene, providing details about the location (on the ship named Le Saint-Jean de la Rochelle), the time of day (early morning with fog), the weather (cool), and the specific date (14 July 1650) along with information about the ship's schedule (restarting on 23 August). This fits the category of 'setting' as it sets the scene for the action that may occur in the play.
stgdir: Sur le navire nommé Le Saint-Jean de la Rochelle, au petit matin, avec du brouillard. Il fait frais, le 14 juillet 1650. Le Saint-Jean repartira le 23 août.
